GOD.content: secret secret of forgiveness: to remain secret, and to become self-forgiveness (via specular identification), and in the ambiguity of se pardonner, to be deprived of sense in this narcissistic reflexivity
GOD.linkedContent: secret secret of forgiveness: to remain secret, and to become self-forgiveness (via specular identification), and in the ambiguity of se pardonner, to be deprived of sense in this narcissistic reflexivity

GOD.content: to ask forgiveness is to identify with the other, auto-affect, hetero-affect
GOD.linkedContent: to ask forgiveness is to identify with the other, auto-affect, hetero-affect

MONL.content: all these problems of identity, as we foolishly say
MONL.linkedContent: all these problems of identity, as we foolishly say

MONL.content: dogmatism of identity, preceded by ipseity?
MONL.linkedContent: dogmatism of identity, preceded by ipseity?

MONL.content: “disorder of identity”:  more threatened and artificial than ever
MONL.linkedContent: “disorder of identity”: more threatened and artificial than ever

MONL.content: disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds
MONL.linkedContent: disorder of identity: does it favor or inhibit anamnesia? heighten desire for memory? both! exhausts us, point of losing our breath, our minds

MONL.content: “only the interminable and indefinitely phantasmatic process of identification endures”
MONL.linkedContent: “only the interminable and indefinitely phantasmatic process of identification endures”

MONL.content: “identificatory modalities: all the poles of imaginary projection in social culture”
MONL.linkedContent: “identificatory modalities: all the poles of imaginary projection in social culture”

MONL.content: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi
MONL.linkedContent: appeal to come (appel à venir) gathers language together in advance, not in unity, identity, but in singularity of its difference to itself: in difference avec soi not d’avec soi

FK.content: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich
FK.linkedContent: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich

OOG.content: for Husserl, genuine objectivity is ideal identity beyond contingent validity [?]: “the automobile is the fastest means of travel” loses its validity w/out losing its omnitemporal ideality
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, genuine objectivity is ideal identity beyond contingent validity [?]: “the automobile is the fastest means of travel” loses its validity w/out losing its omnitemporal ideality

LOBL.content: structure of invagination exposes precariousness of effects of “genre,” “mode, “corpus,” all historical fictions that certify its carte d’identité
LOBL.linkedContent: structure of invagination exposes precariousness of effects of “genre,” “mode, “corpus,” all historical fictions that certify its carte d’identité

POO.content: exemplarity: “example itself, as such, overflows its singularity as much as its identity”
POO.linkedContent: exemplarity: “example itself, as such, overflows its singularity as much as its identity”

SPOM.content: for Marx, ultimate support for dominant discourse: identity, self-identity of social class [Derrida believes he can suspend this idea while still inheriting from Marx]
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, ultimate support for dominant discourse: identity, self-identity of social class [Derrida believes he can suspend this idea while still inheriting from Marx]

SPOM.content: no pure identity if that which is most living have specters inside, weighed down by specters, which think
SPOM.linkedContent: no pure identity if that which is most living have specters inside, weighed down by specters, which think

SPOM.content: before commodities, use-value intact, identical to itself [Derrida deconstructs]; p. 201 use-value as limit concept contaminated in advance
SPOM.linkedContent: before commodities, use-value intact, identical to itself [Derrida deconstructs]; p. 201 use-value as limit concept contaminated in advance

POOF.content: identification qua fraternization, bond btwn 2 necessities (ties): embedding of an ‘it is necessary’ in the filiation of what is, obligation to the natural [p. 102 isonomy from isogony]
POOF.linkedContent: identification qua fraternization, bond btwn 2 necessities (ties): embedding of an ‘it is necessary’ in the filiation of what is, obligation to the natural [p. 102 isonomy from isogony]

POOF.content: a deconstructive thought of # and equality, power of universalization beyond State & nation, the account taken (la prise en compte) of anonymous/irreducible singularities, indifferently different [Schelling?], indifferent to particular difference, to the raging quest for identity corrupting the most indestructible desires of the idiom [democracy’s?]
POOF.linkedContent: a deconstructive thought of # and equality, power of universalization beyond State & nation, the account taken (la prise en compte) of anonymous/irreducible singularities, indifferently different [Schelling?], indifferent to particular difference, to the raging quest for identity corrupting the most indestructible desires of the idiom [democracy’s?]

A.content: border becomes a problem as soon as edge-line is threatened, a step crossing an indivisible line (customs, police, visa—all established upon institution of indivisibility or identity of line)
A.linkedContent: border becomes a problem as soon as edge-line is threatened, a step crossing an indivisible line (customs, police, visa—all established upon institution of indivisibility or identity of line)

SEC.content: isn’t iterability of writing also in speech and in all experience? > never permits unity of self-identity
SEC.linkedContent: isn’t iterability of writing also in speech and in all experience? > never permits unity of self-identity

EM.content: national philosophical identity accommodates a nonidentity
EM.linkedContent: national philosophical identity accommodates a nonidentity

VM.content: acc. Levinas, renounce the other is to enclose oneself in bad solitude of self-identity, to repress ethical transcendence
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, renounce the other is to enclose oneself in bad solitude of self-identity, to repress ethical transcendence

VM.content: acc. Levinas, to see, know, have and will “unfold only within the oppressive and luminous identity of the same” (fundamental categories of ontology/phenomenology)
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, to see, know, have and will “unfold only within the oppressive and luminous identity of the same” (fundamental categories of ontology/phenomenology)

VM.content: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst
VM.linkedContent: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst

VM.content: for Heidegger, same is not a category, it is not the identical, not negation of difference
VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, same is not a category, it is not the identical, not negation of difference

VM.content: thought of Being is thought of other before homogenous identity of concept, before asphyxiation of the same?
VM.linkedContent: thought of Being is thought of other before homogenous identity of concept, before asphyxiation of the same?

PP.content: Thoth supplants and supplements (en le suppléant) its other (father, sun, life, speech, origin or orient); at same time Thoth takes shape from very thing it resists and substitutes for
PP.linkedContent: Thoth supplants and supplements (en le suppléant) its other (father, sun, life, speech, origin or orient); at same time Thoth takes shape from very thing it resists and substitutes for

PP.content: Thoth opposes itself, passes into its other > messenger-god is truly god of absolute passage btwn opposites: god of non-identity (if he had identity: coincidentia oppositorum)
PP.linkedContent: Thoth opposes itself, passes into its other > messenger-god is truly god of absolute passage btwn opposites: god of non-identity (if he had identity: coincidentia oppositorum)

PP.content: “at once (à la fois):” identity is doubled as its simulacrum, phantasm, at once (identity of presence, presence of its identity, doubled as soon as it appears)
PP.linkedContent: “at once (à la fois):” identity is doubled as its simulacrum, phantasm, at once (identity of presence, presence of its identity, doubled as soon as it appears)

OH.content: what is proper to a culture is not to be identical to itself, culture of oneself as culture of other, gathered and divided at the heart, home: [violent syntax] différence (d’) avec soi
OH.linkedContent: what is proper to a culture is not to be identical to itself, culture of oneself as culture of other, gathered and divided at the heart, home: [violent syntax] différence (d’) avec soi

OH.content: heading of the other: first condition of an identity that is not an egocentrism destructive of oneself and the other, not even anti-heading or decapitation
OH.linkedContent: heading of the other: first condition of an identity that is not an egocentrism destructive of oneself and the other, not even anti-heading or decapitation

OH.content: identification is always cultural never natural, always has a capital form, advanced point, capitalizing reserve
OH.linkedContent: identification is always cultural never natural, always has a capital form, advanced point, capitalizing reserve

OH.content: responsibility: making a chance of the memory of a name, of the idiomatic limit > an opening of identity to its future
OH.linkedContent: responsibility: making a chance of the memory of a name, of the idiomatic limit > an opening of identity to its future

OH.content: [summary of political responsibility today] denounce divergences btwn principle and the determined limits of their representation > task always urgent, infinite > identity instituted in responsibility as experience/experiment of the response
OH.linkedContent: [summary of political responsibility today] denounce divergences btwn principle and the determined limits of their representation > task always urgent, infinite > identity instituted in responsibility as experience/experiment of the response

OH.content: whether hospitable or xenophobic, self-affirmation of identity always claims to be responding to call of universality, an inscription of universal in singular, unique testimony to human essence and to what’s proper to man
OH.linkedContent: whether hospitable or xenophobic, self-affirmation of identity always claims to be responding to call of universality, an inscription of universal in singular, unique testimony to human essence and to what’s proper to man

PAS.content: Blanchot disquiets, suspends, infringes on categorical, the self-identity of the category (accusation, judgment) > [infringes] law of identity of “is” in predication
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot disquiets, suspends, infringes on categorical, the self-identity of the category (accusation, judgment) > [infringes] law of identity of “is” in predication

PAS.content: the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”
PAS.linkedContent: the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”

PAS.content: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack
PAS.linkedContent: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack

F.content: self does identify, to resist introjection: but only in “imaginary, occult” way; the “endocryptic identification” designed to keep topography intact and the place safe (le lieu sauf) are cryptofantasmatic, but the inclusion, divisions and partitions are real
F.linkedContent: self does identify, to resist introjection: but only in “imaginary, occult” way; the “endocryptic identification” designed to keep topography intact and the place safe (le lieu sauf) are cryptofantasmatic, but the inclusion, divisions and partitions are real

FWT.content: Derrida distrusts cult of identitarian/communitarian discourse; resists narcissism of minorities developing everywhere—including w/in feminism > yet, “I can understand the vital urgency of an identitarian reflex,” I accept a momentary/prudent alliance [see WAP pp. 3-4], but he can soon mistrust, limit to solidarity in figures of communitarianism or nationalism
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida distrusts cult of identitarian/communitarian discourse; resists narcissism of minorities developing everywhere—including w/in feminism > yet, “I can understand the vital urgency of an identitarian reflex,” I accept a momentary/prudent alliance [see WAP pp. 3-4], but he can soon mistrust, limit to solidarity in figures of communitarianism or nationalism

FWT.content: I am not this or that, I am this and that, this rather than that, acc. the situation/urgency
FWT.linkedContent: I am not this or that, I am this and that, this rather than that, acc. the situation/urgency

WM.content: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales
WM.linkedContent: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales

DS.content: inserting spacing into interiority does not allow inside to identify w/ itself (close upon itself)
DS.linkedContent: inserting spacing into interiority does not allow inside to identify w/ itself (close upon itself)

POS.content: differance common root of oppositional concepts, as common root, is also element of the same (distinguished from the identical [Heidegger]) in which oppositions are announced
POS.linkedContent: differance common root of oppositional concepts, as common root, is also element of the same (distinguished from the identical [Heidegger]) in which oppositions are announced

POS.content: communication: transmission of identity of signified object from one subject (presupposes subject) to another: A communicates B to C
POS.linkedContent: communication: transmission of identity of signified object from one subject (presupposes subject) to another: A communicates B to C

POS.content: spacing makes it impossible for identity to be closed in on itself
POS.linkedContent: spacing makes it impossible for identity to be closed in on itself

OS.content: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double
OS.linkedContent: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double

OS.content: this impossibility contradicts itself, time is name for possibility of impossible, this impossible possibility: alterity & identity of the now maintained in a differentiated element of a certain same
OS.linkedContent: this impossibility contradicts itself, time is name for possibility of impossible, this impossible possibility: alterity & identity of the now maintained in a differentiated element of a certain same

OS.content: the cum, or co- of coexsistence has meaning only on basis of its impossibility
OS.linkedContent: the cum, or co- of coexsistence has meaning only on basis of its impossibility

ROP.content: inability to identify w/ oneself, unify oneself, gather oneself > alliance of destiny, namely tragedy, and chance as the possible or aleatory [no pertinence to dramatization]
ROP.linkedContent: inability to identify w/ oneself, unify oneself, gather oneself > alliance of destiny, namely tragedy, and chance as the possible or aleatory [no pertinence to dramatization]

ROP.content: all identities (madness, reason, history) in history of madness would be divided from w/in, threatened in advance by parasitism, like a computer virus (though w/out any antivirus)
ROP.linkedContent: all identities (madness, reason, history) in history of madness would be divided from w/in, threatened in advance by parasitism, like a computer virus (though w/out any antivirus)

ROP.content: identity (of epoch) fissures, is divided (partagée) the moment a couple [Freud/Nietzsche] is split, even more so when the decoupling occurs in self-identity of some individual (i.e. Freud), historians have trouble with self-difference, cette différence à soi
ROP.linkedContent: identity (of epoch) fissures, is divided (partagée) the moment a couple [Freud/Nietzsche] is split, even more so when the decoupling occurs in self-identity of some individual (i.e. Freud), historians have trouble with self-difference, cette différence à soi

SP.content: no truth in itself of sexual difference in itself, homme/femme en soi > but, ontology w/ its verification of identity, w/ its arraisonnement, shelters (recèle) undecidability of sexual difference
SP.linkedContent: no truth in itself of sexual difference in itself, homme/femme en soi > but, ontology w/ its verification of identity, w/ its arraisonnement, shelters (recèle) undecidability of sexual difference

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s living mother/dead father, identity as double & neutral; “I know both, I am both” [“both” must be read as singular] > la vie la mort: the dead man the living feminine

PS.content: self-presence, Artaud’s “<small>WE KNOW IT WAS WE WHO WERE SPEAKING</small>” > magic identification
PS.linkedContent: self-presence, Artaud’s “WE KNOW IT WAS WE WHO WERE SPEAKING” > magic identification

PS.content: self-presence, unity, self-identity, proper: most profound and permanent ambition of Western metaphysics [?]
PS.linkedContent: self-presence, unity, self-identity, proper: most profound and permanent ambition of Western metaphysics [?]

O.content: if nothing outside text, text not snug airtight (calfeutré) inside of an interiority or an identity-to-itself (d’une identité à soi) > though “dehors à tout prix” can play a reassuring role, un certain dedans peut être terrible
O.linkedContent: if nothing outside text, text not snug airtight (calfeutré) inside of an interiority or an identity-to-itself (d’une identité à soi) > though “dehors à tout prix” can play a reassuring role, un certain dedans peut être terrible

O.content: business (l’affaire) of old name, of onymism in general, of false identity of mark, which dissemination must disturb (doit perturber) at the root [re: “Mallarmé,” guise of homonymy]
O.linkedContent: business (l’affaire) of old name, of onymism in general, of false identity of mark, which dissemination must disturb (doit perturber) at the root [re: “Mallarmé,” guise of homonymy]

O.content: [general economy of hymen]: cette consumation [consumption, consummation], comme celle de l’hymen, ne commence ni ne finit jamais, en quoi son identité se dé-pense
O.linkedContent: [general economy of hymen]: cette consumation [consumption, consummation], comme celle de l’hymen, ne commence ni ne finit jamais, en quoi son identité se dé-pense

Gii.content: Heidegger’s unity [re: Geschlecht], not identity, but preserves the simplicity of the same—even in the form of the fold
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s unity [re: Geschlecht], not identity, but preserves the simplicity of the same—even in the form of the fold

REST.content: by owing the truth, one restitutes it, identifying as assigning points or proper size (pointure)
REST.linkedContent: by owing the truth, one restitutes it, identifying as assigning points or proper size (pointure)

REST.content: what if, and Derrida sees it too, they’re 2 left shoes, a double that fudges (brouille) both “pair & identity” à la fois—paralyzes directionality, fait loucher vers le diable
REST.linkedContent: what if, and Derrida sees it too, they’re 2 left shoes, a double that fudges (brouille) both “pair & identity” à la fois—paralyzes directionality, fait loucher vers le diable

REST.content: logic of false parity (rather than false identity) constructs the trap?
REST.linkedContent: logic of false parity (rather than false identity) constructs the trap?

REST.content: identification, like attribution, has supplementary/parergonal structure > because demand for reattachment is insatiable, unsatisfied, always making a higher bid, always starts out again
REST.linkedContent: identification, like attribution, has supplementary/parergonal structure > because demand for reattachment is insatiable, unsatisfied, always making a higher bid, always starts out again

REST.content: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself
REST.linkedContent: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself

DST.content: w/ both Lacoue-Labarthe & Heidegger, Derrida wonders about unity of unthought—couldn’t the unthought be désistance, & doesn’t désistance enforce an irreducible dispersion that disidentifies even a concept of a subject that exceeds the metaphysical one?
DST.linkedContent: w/ both Lacoue-Labarthe & Heidegger, Derrida wonders about unity of unthought—couldn’t the unthought be désistance, & doesn’t désistance enforce an irreducible dispersion that disidentifies even a concept of a subject that exceeds the metaphysical one?

DST.content: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]
DST.linkedContent: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]

DST.content: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified
DST.linkedContent: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified

EJQB.content: Jew’s identification w/ himself doesn’t exist
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew’s identification w/ himself doesn’t exist

AFR.content: Condillac: if there is fundamentally only one machine, there is fundamentally only one property > unique property assures possibility of “identical propositions,” this self-evident identity (nontautological) is discovered by way of Reason, is “the only sign of evidence” > all modifications are those of first property modifying itself: sensibility
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: if there is fundamentally only one machine, there is fundamentally only one property > unique property assures possibility of “identical propositions,” this self-evident identity (nontautological) is discovered by way of Reason, is “the only sign of evidence” > all modifications are those of first property modifying itself: sensibility

AFR.content: Condillac’s non-Cartesian indubitability: first property which knows itself (sensibility)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s non-Cartesian indubitability: first property which knows itself (sensibility)

AFR.content: Condillac’s identical proposition as powerful circle, finality of the same, circle of identity, self-evidence [brings whole to part] [but how can this circle close if whole is different from part?]
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s identical proposition as powerful circle, finality of the same, circle of identity, self-evidence [brings whole to part] [but how can this circle close if whole is different from part?]

AFR.content: frivolity originates from deviation or gap of signifier, also from its folding back on itself in closed, nonrepresentative identity
AFR.linkedContent: frivolity originates from deviation or gap of signifier, also from its folding back on itself in closed, nonrepresentative identity

AFR.content: we escape frivolity only at semantic risk of nonidentity; Condillac names nonidentity metaphor, makes it the primordial structure of language to begin its analogical/teleological reappropriation
AFR.linkedContent: we escape frivolity only at semantic risk of nonidentity; Condillac names nonidentity metaphor, makes it the primordial structure of language to begin its analogical/teleological reappropriation

PJP.content: Derrida considers anacoluthon the most productive figure, a general formalization of Miller’s “polylogology”: multiplicity of voices, more than 1 voice in 1 voice, trace of perjury gets lost, leads us astray > this dispersion threatens concept, identity, identity of “I”
PJP.linkedContent: Derrida considers anacoluthon the most productive figure, a general formalization of Miller’s “polylogology”: multiplicity of voices, more than 1 voice in 1 voice, trace of perjury gets lost, leads us astray > this dispersion threatens concept, identity, identity of “I”

PJP.content: essential finitude of discontinuous anamnesis inscribes ellipses/eclipses in identity of subject
PJP.linkedContent: essential finitude of discontinuous anamnesis inscribes ellipses/eclipses in identity of subject

PJP.content: undecided btwn provocative irony, disarming sincerity: one responds both responsibly & irresponsibly
PJP.linkedContent: undecided btwn provocative irony, disarming sincerity: one responds both responsibly & irresponsibly

D.content: only that which can be repeated in its identity can have unity
D.linkedContent: only that which can be repeated in its identity can have unity

LI.content: structure of iteration implies both identity (minimum of idealization) and difference (minimum of remainder)
LI.linkedContent: structure of iteration implies both identity (minimum of idealization) and difference (minimum of remainder)

LI.content: iterability of an element divides its own identity a priori > differential btwn & w/in elements
LI.linkedContent: iterability of an element divides its own identity a priori > differential btwn & w/in elements

LI.content: idealization (identity in repetition) is made possible by iterability, while broaching/breaching (entame) the idealization at once > iterability alters, contaminates, what it identifies
LI.linkedContent: idealization (identity in repetition) is made possible by iterability, while broaching/breaching (entame) the idealization at once > iterability alters, contaminates, what it identifies

LI.content: iterability: ruins (even ideally) the very identity it makes possible
LI.linkedContent: iterability: ruins (even ideally) the very identity it makes possible

TN.content: how could [Husserl’s] identical coincidence open up to anything else?
TN.linkedContent: how could [Husserl’s] identical coincidence open up to anything else?

NOY.content: thought of history of Being affected by internal epochē, divides, suspends the yes: will is not identical to itself (along w/ many other things) > yes as the incalculable, the promise: [quasi-, fable of] “giving reason,” “giving an account,” the countability of the innumerable yesses
NOY.linkedContent: thought of history of Being affected by internal epochē, divides, suspends the yes: will is not identical to itself (along w/ many other things) > yes as the incalculable, the promise: [quasi-, fable of] “giving reason,” “giving an account,” the countability of the innumerable yesses

E.content: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis
E.linkedContent: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis

LG.content: trait common to classes should follow a code that determines belonging, an identifiable trait identical to itself > but, this trait qua mark always a priori remarkable
LG.linkedContent: trait common to classes should follow a code that determines belonging, an identifiable trait identical to itself > but, this trait qua mark always a priori remarkable

OG.content: via Rousseau’s pity, ours is the others, identification as non-identification
OG.linkedContent: via Rousseau’s pity, ours is the others, identification as non-identification

SPEC.content: [for Freud?] no mélange of pleasure–unpleasure is possible, mélange is madness > though topical distribution [in Beyond…] is effect of differance, it retains differance in reassuring medium & in oppositional logic > principle of identity is respected by topology, division of sites
SPEC.linkedContent: [for Freud?] no mélange of pleasure–unpleasure is possible, mélange is madness > though topical distribution [in Beyond…] is effect of differance, it retains differance in reassuring medium & in oppositional logic > principle of identity is respected by topology, division of sites

SPEC.content: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic
SPEC.linkedContent: that which entraps speculation: murderous, mournful, jealous, guilty identifications [re: Freud’s relation to death of his & Ernst’s younger brother] > rigorous stricture, legacy & jealousy of a repetition (already jealous of itself) pull its [fort:da’s] strings (tirent les fils) more or less strictly > scene of writing becomes auto-bio-thanato-hetero-graphic

FV.content: analysand seeing his/her double: “uncontrollable anxiety” disrupts every verification of identity, obstacle for transference
FV.linkedContent: analysand seeing his/her double: “uncontrollable anxiety” disrupts every verification of identity, obstacle for transference

WBH.content: gift determines, produces identity of giver & receiver, gives itself the right to determine, always a strike of force, irruption
WBH.linkedContent: gift determines, produces identity of giver & receiver, gives itself the right to determine, always a strike of force, irruption
